title: 104_hr2174
content: Commission on Missing-in-Action and Prisoners of War in Southeast Asia Act - Establishes the Commission on Missing-in-Action and Prisoners of War in Southeast Asia to: (1) conduct a comprehensive study of efforts made by the government of Vietnam to account for any US personnel who remain unaccounted for as a result of military or Federal Government service in Southeast Asia during the Vietnam era. And (2) report to the Congress on the study's findings and recommendations. Terminates the Commission 90 days after submission of such report. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the appropriate congressional committees should: (1) initiate hearings to consider the findings and recommendations of the report. And (2) consider whether to adopt a resolution stating the sense of the Congress on whether diplomatic relations between the United States and Vietnam should be maintained.
